page.title: 01Wickhambreaux Parish.
page.content: This area is very agricultural, a rural district; there is a variety of crops including apples, pears, grass and a lot of corn. Altogether there are ten farms most of which grow arable crops or fruit; in the{ {Stodmarsh village }area and on{Seaton {Marsh}cattle and sheep are reared. The{nature reserve}south-east of Hersden was once covered by sea, separating the Isle of Thanet from the mainland; it is now lakes and reeds. This is a quiet area with only small communities such as{Stodmarsh and some of{Wickhambreaux Village. There are three valleys in this district; the{Little Stour Valley,}the {Great Stour Valley}and the{Lampen } {Stream Valley.}The Great Stour flows north-east to{Grove Ferry,}as does the Little Stour and they meet at{Plucks {Gutter.
